intro: Chlamydocarya rostrata, commonly known as the rostrated chlamydocarya, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive rostrated (beak-like) calyx, which gives it its scientific name. Its flowers are typically pink or white, with five petals and numerous stamens. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded forest understories.
